intro: Cercouratea rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed fern, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive round or oval-shaped leaves, which are often clustered at the base of the plant. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
